rule.name: Value must not be negative
rule.description:
A value must not be negative.

Noncompliant Code Example

			 
			  y = x % -2;  // Noncompliant; -2 is a negative

Compliant Solution

			 
			  y = x % 2;

rule.name: Integer Overflow
rule.description: For the predicate integer_overflow(op,e1,e2,t) the value of the result of the operation e1 op e2 does not exceed the maximum representable value of the type t, if t is a signed type.

rule.name: No Overlap
rule.description:
Given a memory state s = (m,t,v) with memory configuration m, type assignment t, and valuation function v, and a canonical construct c we denote by s(c) the value of c in memory state s in its appropriate value domain, that is, an lvalue maps to a location, an expression maps to a value of its type, and an loffset maps to a non-negative integer.

Let s=(m,v) be a memory state with memory configuration m and valuation function v. Let l=(b,off) be a location in the set of valid locations for m L_m with base address b and offset off.

For the predicate overlap(s,l_1,l_2,len) we say for a given l_1 and l_2 in L_m, where l_1 = (b_1, off_1) and l_2 = (b_2, off_2), if b_1 == b_2 and |off_1 - off_2| < len then the regions overlap. For the predicate no_overlap the negation of overlap applies.

rule.name: null-terminated
rule.description:
Given a memory state s = (m,t,v) with memory configuration m, type assignment t, and valuation function v, and a canonical construct c we denote by s(c) the value of c in memory state s in its appropriate value domain, that is, an lvalue maps to a location, an expression maps to a value of its type, and an loffset maps to a non-negative integer.

Let s=(m,v) be a memory state with memory configuration m and valuation function v. Let l=(b,off) be a location in the set of valid locations for m L_m with base address b and offset off.

For the predicate null_terminated(s,l) we say there exists a location l_1 = (b,k) . v(l_1) = '\0' for all l_1 in L_m where k >= off. The character '\0' is the null termination character for strings.

rule.name: Pointer Cast
rule.description:
Given a memory state s = (m,t,v) with memory configuration m, type assignment t, and valuation function v, and a canonical construct c we denote by s(c) the value of c in memory state s in its appropriate value domain, that is, an lvalue maps to a location, an expression maps to a value of its type, and an loffset maps to a non-negative integer. For cast expressions we have s(cast type_src type_tgt exp) = cast type_src type_tgt (s(exp)).

Cast operations to pointer types may lead to undefined behavior, but only at the time of dereference. For any s(x) defined in terms of f(e_1, e_2, ..., e_n) if e_i = undefined for some i, 1 <= i <= n, then s(x) = undefined (that is, there is no recovery from an undefined value). For any s(x) defined in terms of f(e_1, e_2, ..., e_n) if s(x) <> undefined and if e_i = uninitialized for some i, 1 <= i <= n, then s(x) = uninitialized.

rule.name: Pointer Lower Bound
rule.description: For the predicate lower_bound(ptr,t) the element ptr is an address into a memory region r such that ptr >= lb(r), where r is a declared or allocated memory region of size s bytes, lb(r) is the base address of the region, and ub(r) = lb(r) + s is the upper bound of the region.

rule.name: Signed to Unsigned Cast
rule.description:
Given a memory state s = (m,t,v) with memory configuration m, type assignment t, and valuation function v, and a canonical construct c we denote by s(c) the value of c in memory state s in its appropriate value domain, that is, an lvalue maps to a location, an expression maps to a value of its type, and an loffset maps to a non-negative integer. For cast expressions we have s(cast type_src type_tgt exp) = cast type_src type_tgt (s(exp)).

Cast operations may result in an undefined expression value if the source and target type are not compatible. A common type of cast operation in C programs is the cast from signed int to unsigned int: 

            cast(signed int, unsigned int, exp)
For example, this type of cast is performed implicitly whenever a signed integer is a passed to a function that expects an unsigned integer as argument, such as the length parameter in memcpy(.,.,size t len). For this particular case we have
